result.execSummary:
The defendant Natividad ALTAMIRANO Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Natividad ALTAMIRANO Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Natividad ALTAMIRANO Jr was found guilty of Obstruct Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reminder Notice - Final Notice
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.

Count 2 - Obstruct officer - No contest plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, fleeing an officer.  Motion granted.  Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for forty-five (45) days, under the Huber Law, to commence on 10-26-14 by 5:00 p.m.  Transfer to Sheboygan County Jail is authorized.  $443.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 11-11-14 or 9 days jail.

At 10:07 a.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  the person of Natividad Altamirano, DOB: 07-19-1990.

OWI Search Warrant - Section 968.12, Wisconsin Statutes.
Return of Officer.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of OWI - 2nd offense, fleeing an officer and vehicle owner liability fleeing an officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-06-14 at 9:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
